origin.medievalorigins.arachnae.name: Arachnae
origin.medievalorigins.arachnae.descript: Arachnae have the strength of a man with the dexterity and cunning of a spider. A truly terrifying hunter.
origin.medievalorigins.banshee.name: Banshee
origin.medievalorigins.banshee.descripti: Banshees are anguished spirits whose cries can shatter glass and drive people to madness. In myth, their presence is often considered an omen of death.
origin.medievalorigins.incubus.name: Incubus
origin.medievalorigins.incubus.descripti: Incubi are evil servants of a dark power. Powerful in their own realm, but losing their soul has left them weak to pure sources.
origin.medievalorigins.dwarf.name: Dwarf
origin.medievalorigins.dwarf.description: Dwarves are practical, stocky, and prideful. They excel at mining and living underground, but struggle with the daylight. Rock and stone, brother.
origin.medievalorigins.wood_elf.name: Wood Elf
origin.medievalorigins.wood_elf.descript: Wood Elves are a wise, long-lived race in touch with the Earth. They are natural archers who excel in the forest, but are otherwise weak.
origin.medievalorigins.fae.name: Fae
origin.medievalorigins.fae.description: Fae are short magical creatures, regarded as spirits of nature and said to haunt forests and lead travelers' astray
origin.medievalorigins.goblin.name: Goblin
origin.medievalorigins.goblin.descriptio: Obsessed with gold and treasure, goblins tend to find a little more loot wherever they look, but their small size leaves them vulnerable in combat.
origin.medievalorigins.gorgon.name: Gorgon
origin.medievalorigins.gorgon.descriptio: Gorgons were humans cursed by the Gods. With hair made of writhing snakes and a horrifying visage said to petrify those who witness it, Gorgons are often called monsters.
origin.medievalorigins.moon_elf.name: Moon Elf
origin.medievalorigins.moon_elf.descript: Mysterious, ethereal beings not of this world. They're named not for their homeland, but rather the only thing their victims see before they kill them.
origin.medievalorigins.necromancer.name: Necromancer
origin.medievalorigins.necromancer.descr: Deeply implanted in the forbidden art of raising the dead, a Necromancer can raise an army from nothing. But this morbid relationship with death comes with consequences.
origin.medievalorigins.ogre.name: Ogre
origin.medievalorigins.ogre.description: Ogre been called brute before. Ogre no like that. Make ogre angry. Man who made angry have no head now. Man real quiet after that.
origin.medievalorigins.pixie.name: Pixie
origin.medievalorigins.pixie.description: Harbingers of good fortune, but agents of mischief. Tiny.
origin.medievalorigins.plague_victim.des: Carrier of the Plague, it affects the victim's daily life yet does not kill them. Used correctly, it can be a powerful weapon against their foes.
origin.medievalorigins.siren.name: Siren
origin.medievalorigins.siren.description: Sirens have an ensnaring aura; their irresistible beauty is said to be the downfall of many a foolish sailor. Pity to those who confuse beauty with goodness...
origin.medievalorigins.troll.name: Troll
origin.medievalorigins.troll.description: Large, lumbering beasts hailing from mountains, trolls are some of the most aggressive brutes in the land. But their tremendous size can be their downfall.
origin.medievalorigins.yeti.name: Yeti
origin.medievalorigins.yeti.description: Lumbering giants of frosty peaks, the Yeti's icy nature allows them to stop almost any foe, but can leave them vulnerable to fiery attacks.
power.medievalorigins.arachnae/bottomles: Being a human sized spider presents unique challenges. Arachnae require a large quantity of food to stay alive.
power.medievalorigins.arachnae/brittle.d: The Arachnae's exoskeleton cannot support armor heavier than iron. This can be prevented with an enchantment.
power.medievalorigins.arachnae/climber.d: The fine bristles on the Arachnae's legs allow them to climb up walls.
power.medievalorigins.arachnae/fragile_e: The Arachnae's exoskeleton is vulnerable to damage. Their health is less compared to a regular human's.
power.medievalorigins.arachnae/many_eyes: The Arachnae's eight eyes are all adpated to darkness, and allow them to see clearly even with very little light.
power.medievalorigins.arachnae/venomous_: Arachnae's fangs contain venom, and every bite is a chance to poison their opponent.
power.medievalorigins.arachnae/web_sling: Arachnae can, on command, spin webs in which their opponents will be immobilised for a short while.
power.medievalorigins.banshee/spectral.d: Banshees possess the ability to become intangible at will, meaning they cannot be affected by foes in the physical realm. This of course comes with a cooldown. Activated with the secondary power key.
power.medievalorigins.banshee/flesheater: Banshees feast upon the organs of the living. Their spectral bodies have no desire for fruit or vegetables.
power.medievalorigins.banshee/hexed.name: Hexed
power.medievalorigins.banshee/hexed.desc: Banshees are known for their cursing prowess. Every time they are hit, there is a small chance that the attacker will be consigned to a fate of slow, agonising death.
power.medievalorigins.banshee/immaterial: Being incorporeal does not come without consequence. Banshees have half the health a living person would have.
power.medievalorigins.banshee/iron_avers: Iron is lethal to banshees. They cannot bear to wear it.
power.medievalorigins.banshee/sonic_shri: Banshees can unleash a terrifying focused screech at one target, dealing magic damage and nauseating them.
An incubus' bloodlust is insatiable. If it isn't the flesh of an animal, its worthless.
power.medievalorigins.incubus/demon_fire: Imbued with the devil's power, the incubus can release a burst of hell's energy on command. Triggered with secondary power key.
Having spent eternities in the depths of hell, fire feels like home - it deals no damage to Incubi and satiates them.
power.medievalorigins.incubus/hydrophobe: Water scalds Incubi, damaging them on contact.
power.medievalorigins.incubus/impure.des: Much like the undead, incubi are saturated with dark energy and can not receive healing from potions.
power.medievalorigins.incubus/dimension_: As agents of hell, Incubi are not accustomed to Overworld dimensions and are weaker there. But they are considerably stronger in the Nether.
power.medievalorigins.incubus/unholy_dea: An incubus can exchange some of their life force for raw power for a short time. Triggered with Primary Active key.
power.medievalorigins.dwarf/darkness_dwe: Dwarven eyes are adapted for the dark. Direct sunlight burns their sensitive retinas, blinding them until darkness returns. Prevented by wearing a gold helmet.
power.medievalorigins.dwarf/dense.name: Dense
power.medievalorigins.dwarf/dense.descri: Dwarves are heavy for their size; they sink in water.
power.medievalorigins.dwarf/dwarven_tech: Dwarves can mine significantly faster than others.
power.medievalorigins.dwarf/miniature.de: Dwarves are shorter than humans, but almost as wide as them
power.medievalorigins.dwarf/mythril_reso: Powerful metals which carry the spirit of your people fill you with might.
power.medievalorigins.dwarf/nocturnal_ey: Living underground has lead to dwarves having highly sensitive eyes, able to see perfectly fine even in the pitch black of the caverns.
power.medievalorigins.dwarf/photoallergi: Dwarven skin is far too sensitive for the world outside of their mountainous cave homes, direct sunlight burns them, unless wearing a helmet.
Dwarves are notorious for their powerful drinks which would knock out someone twice their size. Activate to take a swig and fully restore health.
power.medievalorigins.wood_elf/archer.de: Wood Elves spend their whole lives training with bows - they start with one, and their arrows are more deadly.
power.medievalorigins.wood_elf/empowered: After charging for a few seconds, release an arrow at tremendous velocity, piercing enemies, flying further, and dealing significantly more damage.
power.medievalorigins.wood_elf/forest_vi: After centuries in the grove, Wood Elven eyes are well adapted to be among trees; while in forests, they can see clearly even at night.
power.medievalorigins.wood_elf/eagle_eye: Wood Elves' enhanced perception allows them to keep track of an enemy for a while after hitting them, even when they aren't in view.
power.medievalorigins.wood_elf/elegant.d: Due to their slender nature, Wood Elves can not wear armor heavier than iron (This can be prevented with an enchantment), and have less health.
power.medievalorigins.wood_elf/steward.d: Wood elves live off the forest and in harmony with it. They can not digest meat.
Wood elves are taller than the average human. Despite this, they are just as thin.
Elven arms are not as powerful, but they are quick. They deal reduced damage but attack slightly faster.
power.medievalorigins.fae/allure.name: Allure
power.medievalorigins.fae/allure.descrip: Faes are naturally alluring. Unfortunately, this means that mobs will pursue them from far further away than they would other creatures.
power.medievalorigins.fae/diminutive.des: It is rare for a fae to break 5 feet in height. They are small creatures, even smaller than the weaselly goblins.
Iron inhibits fae powers. It is unbearable for them to wear it.
power.medievalorigins.fae/levitation.des: Faes are light magical creatures who can float effortlessly on the air. Press the primary active key to hover upward.
power.medievalorigins.fae/magic_resistan: As magical creatures themselves, faes take less magic damage compared to other creatures.
power.medievalorigins.fae/regen.name: Regeneration
power.medievalorigins.fae/regen.descript: Faes are magic creatures. Press your secondary power key and you will regenerate health for a short period, at the cost of your hunger.
power.medievalorigins.goblin/cunning.des: Goblins are clever creatures who know how to find slightly more rare loot, though some say it's just luck.
power.medievalorigins.goblin/frail.name: Frail
power.medievalorigins.goblin/frail.descr: Due to their small stature, goblins' max health is reduced, leaving them very prone to damage.
power.medievalorigins.goblin/greedy.name: Greedy
power.medievalorigins.goblin/greedy.desc: Goblins love treasure - by simply wearing or wielding gold, they get unique benefits.
power.medievalorigins.goblin/nippy.name: Nimble
power.medievalorigins.goblin/nippy.descr: Although short, goblins are quite fast, allowing them to outrun most stronger enemies instead of fighting.
power.medievalorigins.goblin/stunted.des: Goblins are two thirds the height of a human.
Gorgons can not tolerate the purity of water and take damage from it.
power.medievalorigins.gorgon/to_stone.de: Gorgons were cursed with being bound in dark, dank caves. Being outside in daylight causes them to become petrified until night. Can be negated by wearing a helmet.
power.medievalorigins.gorgon/silver_aver: Gorgons are weak to the purity of silver - they can not stand to wear it and take damage when wielding it. (Iron is also counted as silver)
power.medievalorigins.gorgon/petrifying_: Meet the eyes of any mob facing you, turning them to stone briefly. Does not work on bosses or players.
power.medievalorigins.gorgon/poison_bloo: Gorgons are immune to poison, and have a chance to spill their toxic blood onto nearby enemies when hit, poisoning them.
power.medievalorigins.gorgon/revenge.des: Centuries of being cursed then blamed for their misfortune has left Gorgon's bitter. They deal massively increased damage at low health.
power.medievalorigins.moon_elf/crazed.de: Try as they might, Moon Elves can not sleep in the overworld.
power.medievalorigins.moon_elf/stealth.d: In the dark, Moon Elves can turn invisible by sneaking, and move a short distance while stealthed. When attacking from stealth, their first attack deals bonus damage and ends the invisibility.
power.medievalorigins.moon_elf/elegant.d: Due to their slim builds, Moon Elves can not wear armor heavier than iron. This can be prevented with an enchantment.
Moon elves are thin and even slightly translucent, and their skin has a peculiar blue hue.
power.medievalorigins.moon_elf/moonlight: Moon Elves are most efficient wielding a light and easy to conceal weapon. They deal more damage with daggers and knives.
power.medievalorigins.moon_elf/fragile.d: Moon Elves have to stay lightweight to maintain their agility. They have reduced health and take increased physical damage.
power.medievalorigins.moon_elf/nimble.de: With their quick reflexes, Moon Elves have a small chance to dodge any attack.
Moon Elves are about the same height as their distant relatives of the forest, making them slightly taller than humans.
power.medievalorigins.necromancer/black_: Necromancers only work with death. They cannot harvest any crops, they wilt at their deathly touch.
power.medievalorigins.necromancer/distur: Learning the art of necromancy is traumatising. Necromancers cannot sleep, too scared to dream of what they wish they did not know.
power.medievalorigins.necromancer/hellra: At will, a necromancer can raise a circle of skeletons, acting as a shield to block projectiles. This only lasts for a short time.
power.medievalorigins.necromancer/imperv: The study of death has made Necromancers immune to poison, wither and instant damage. Unfortunately, this also means they do not recieve the positive effects from regeneration and instant health.
power.medievalorigins.necromancer/poor_r: Unfortunately, students of the dark arts are feared by the general populace. Villagers will refuse to trade with Necromancers and iron golems will attack them on sight. This does, however, come with the bonus that they are accepted amongst the ranks of the Pillagers.
power.medievalorigins.necromancer/resili: Learning about death goes a long way towards avoiding it. Necromancers have increased health.
power.medievalorigins.necromancer/siphon: Rip out some of your soul and radiate it into a field around you, strengthening any mob which is not hostile to you, at a cost.
power.medievalorigins.necromancer/unguar: Enveloping oneself in the arcane leaves you open to attack in the physical realm. Most mobs deal more damage to necromancers.
power.medievalorigins.ogre/gargantuan.de: Ogre always been called big. All ogre know is ogre can't fit through door.
power.medievalorigins.ogre/lead_belly.de: Ogre do not care what eat. Food is food. Poison? Hunger? What those?
power.medievalorigins.ogre/ravenous.name: Ravenous
power.medievalorigins.ogre/ravenous.desc: Ogre hungry all the time. If ogre could, ogre would only eat all day.
power.medievalorigins.ogre/ravager.name: Ravager
power.medievalorigins.ogre/ravager.descr: Ogre like kill things with axe. Axe feel right in ogre hand.
power.medievalorigins.ogre/bloodlust.des: Ogre get mad some time. Ogre real fast when mad. But ogre hurt when mad. So ogre try not get mad too much. (Activate with Primary Active key)
power.medievalorigins.ogre/sluggish.name: Sluggish
power.medievalorigins.ogre/sluggish.desc: Ogre real slow. Never won race in whole life.
Ogre like green metal. Ogre not sure why. Feel like home.
power.medievalorigins.ogre/stocky.name: Stocky
power.medievalorigins.ogre/stocky.descri: Ogre strong. Hard to kill ogre.
power.medievalorigins.pixie/curse_of_fli: The wings which allows pixies to fly also prevent even the most skilled of craftsmen from creating a chestplate to accommodate them.
power.medievalorigins.pixie/feather_foot: The pixie's small size means it is completely impossible for them to take fall damage.
power.medievalorigins.pixie/flight.name: Flight
power.medievalorigins.pixie/flight.descr: Pixies are blessed with the gift of flight.
power.medievalorigins.pixie/good_fortune: Although pixies can be troublesome, they are also associated with good luck. When mining, you will occasionally get something valubale from plain stone.
power.medievalorigins.pixie/mischief_mak: Pixies are capable of performing numerous mischievous acts which, if not not dangerous, are certainly loud.
power.medievalorigins.pixie/pixie_proper: Pixies are some of the smallest creatures to roam the land, rarely reaching even the height of a regular person's knee.
power.medievalorigins.pixie/soaked.name: Soaked
power.medievalorigins.pixie/soaked.descr: Being as small as they are, water poses signficant threat to pixies. It hampers their movement and impairs their ability to fly.
power.medievalorigins.pixie/troublemaker: Villagers know pixies by the legends of trouble they cause, and will refuse to trade with them.
power.medievalorigins.plague_victim/cont: The Plague is highly contagious. Villagers will refuse to trade with you out of fear of contracting the plague.
power.medievalorigins.plague_victim/foul: Plague carrying fleas swarm the victim. Being in the general vicinity of them is not beneficial for one's health.
power.medievalorigins.plague_victim/inso: The horrible welts make sleep impossible for carriers of the Plague to sleep.
power.medievalorigins.plague_victim/plag: Although the plague affects the carrier, they do not suffer the brunt of its symptoms. Carriers are immune to poison and wither.
power.medievalorigins.plague_victim/risk: Every contact with a plague victim is a 50/50 on whether you will contract the disease or not. Their opponents best pray that they get lucky...
power.medievalorigins.plague_victim/sens: The Plague causes welts and lesions upon the skin, which are tender and painful to touch. As a result, victims cannot wear armor for the pain it causes.
power.medievalorigins.plague_victim/skin: The Plague causes rapid muscle atrophy, resulting in reduced health and speed.
power.medievalorigins.siren/amphibious.d: Sirens, being a subset of merpeople, can survive in water, and swim with increased speed.
power.medievalorigins.siren/flammable.de: Sirens and fire do not mix well. Any contact with flames results in instant death. Be sure to watch your step in the nether!
power.medievalorigins.siren/holy_water.d: Sirens have regenerative powers, which are at full force when they are in water.
power.medievalorigins.siren/out_of_your_: Although sirens can survive just fine on land, it is not their natural environment. As such, their regenerative abilities do not apply, and any damage taken can only be healed with potions.
power.medievalorigins.siren/prone.name: Prone
power.medievalorigins.siren/prone.descri: While sirens can regenerate their bodies, they are weak to blunt force. Melee attacks do more damage to them.
power.medievalorigins.siren/siren_song.d: Sirens are known for their alluring calls. Press the primary active key to make all mobs around you neutral until hit. Does not work on bosses or players.
power.medievalorigins.siren/seduce.name: Captivate
power.medievalorigins.siren/seduce.descr: A siren can overwhelm with their beauty, convincing villagers to give more favorable trades. To perform, look at a villager and press the secondary active key.
power.medievalorigins.siren/water_vision: Sirens have superior underwater vision than other creatures.
power.medievalorigins.troll/apex_predato: Trolls cannot eat regular foodstuffs, and can only satiate their hunger by slaughtering other creautres.
power.medievalorigins.troll/ham_fisted.d: While the huge fists of the troll pack a mighty punch, they are far too cumbersome to hold a shield.
power.medievalorigins.troll/ironhide.des: Trolls have incredibly thick skin, giving them a natural armor and massively increased health.
power.medievalorigins.troll/lumbering.de: When you're as large as a troll, you have a lot of weight to heft around. Movement is noticably slower than one would expect for their size.
Trolls take after the mountains from which they come from. They are massively tall, twice the size of the average person.
power.medievalorigins.troll/old_blood.de: The old blood which runs through the veins of the trolls is bound to the mountains. They cannot heal themselves outside of their hilly homelands.
power.medievalorigins.troll/out_of_stock: Try as they might, trolls never seem to be able to find any armor in their size. Thus, they are doomed to walk with what coverings nature gave them, and nothing more.
power.medievalorigins.troll/rock_throw.d: A troll can, at will, hurl a large rock into the air, plowing through whatever may cross its path. However, this does come at the cost of 64 precious cobblestone blocks.
power.medievalorigins.troll/thunderous_s: Trolls walk with purpose. Should they persist long enough, they can walk straight through any obstacle which may cross their path.
power.medievalorigins.yeti/flammable.des: Yetis are susceptible to fire damage due to their wintry nature.
A powerful magic runs through the veins of a yeti, allowing them to entomb a group of foes in ice on command. Does not work in the nether or on bosses.
power.medievalorigins.yeti/from_whence_y: Thriving best in the lands from which they originate, yetis move faster and are carried on the snow to negate fall damage in icy biomes.
power.medievalorigins.yeti/frosty_breath: The frosty breath of the yeti slows any opponents which get close to them.
power.medievalorigins.yeti/thick_fur.des: The blessing of thick fur becomes a curse in deserts. Your movement is slowed and health reduced to that of a normal person.
power.medievalorigins.yeti/titanic.name: Titanic
power.medievalorigins.yeti/titanic.descr: Yetis have far more health than a regular human.
power.medievalorigins.yeti/unstoppable.d: Yetis are immune to the slowness effect.
power.medievalorigins.yeti/winter_body.d: Yetis are marginally taller than a regular human, and significantly wider.
enchantment.medievalorigins.featherweigh: With this enchantment applied to heavy armor, it can be worn by Arachnae and Elven origins
medievalorigins.contagious_villager: This villager has already been infected!
medievalorigins.disturbed_restless: What you know will kill you, but you will die laughing.
medievalorigins.moon_elf_no_sleep: The strange sounds of this foreign world leave you restless.
medievalorigins.insomniac_welts: Your welts sting and burn. There will be no sleep for you tonight.
medievalorigins.poor_reputation_villager: The villager is too scared to trade with you!
medievalorigins.troublemaker: Villagers don't trade with the likes of you!
medievalorigins.uncastable: You can't use this ability right now.
